parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From dia and sozo; to save thoroughly, i.e. to cure, preserve, rescue, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: From epi and ginosko; to know upon some mark, i.e. Recognize; by implication, to become fully acquainted with, to acknowledge.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
An island. Probably from the base of naus; an island.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.
Melita, now Malta. Of uncertain origin; Melita, an island in the Mediterranean.
